field.name: SBR
field.description:
Baud Rate Modulo Divisor
 The 13 bits in SBR[12:0] are referred to collectively as BR. They set the modulo divide rate for the
 UART baud rate generator. When BR is cleared, the UART baud rate generator is disabled to reduce
 supply current. When BR is 1 - 8191, the UART baud rate equals BUSCLK/(16xBR)

field.name: RXEDGIE
field.description: RxD Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable (RXEDGIF)

field.name: LBKDIE
field.description: LIN Break Detect Interrupt Enable

field.name: SBR
field.description: Baud Rate Modulo Divisor (see BDH[SBR])

field.name: PT
field.description: Parity Type

field.name: PE
field.description: Parity Enable

field.name: ILT
field.description: Idle Line Type Select\n Determines if idle character bit count starts after start bit or stop bit

field.name: WAKE
field.description: Receiver Wakeup Method Select

field.name: M
field.description: 9-Bit or 8-Bit Mode Select

field.name: RSRC
field.description: Receiver Source Select\nSelect between loop-back and single-wire mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Internal loop back mode\t- The receiver input is internally connected to transmitter output

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Single-wire mode\t- The receiver input is connected to the transmit pin input signal

field.name: UARTSWAI
field.description: Stops in Wait Mode\nControls action in Wait Mode

field.name: LOOPS
field.description: Loop Mode Select\n Controls loop mode where transmitter output is internally connected to receiver input. [See also RSRC]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Loop mode\t where output internally connected to input

field.name: SBK
field.description: Send Break

field.name: RWU
field.description: Receiver Wakeup Control\n Setting RWU enables the wakeup function and inhibits further receiver interrupt requests.\n Normally, hardware wakes the receiver by automatically clearing RWU

field.name: RE
field.description: Receiver Enable

field.name: TE
field.description: Transmitter Enable

field.name: ILIE
field.description: Idle Line Interrupt Enable\n Enables the idle line flag, S1[IDLE], to generate interrupt requests , based on the state of C5[ILDMAS]

field.name: RIE
field.description: Receiver Full Interrupt/DMA requests\n Allows interrupt or DMA requests triggered by RDRF

field.name: TCIE
field.description: Transmission Complete Interrupt/DMA requests\n Controls interrupt or DMA requests triggered by TDRE

field.name: TIE
field.description: Transmitter Interrupt/DMA Transfer Enable

field.name: PF
field.description: Parity Error Flag\n PF is set when PE is set, S2[LBKDE] is disabled, and the parity of the received data does not match its parity bit.\n To clear PF, read S1 with PF set and then read D

field.name: FE
field.description: Framing Error Flag\n FE is set when a logic 0 is accepted as the stop bit.\n To clear FE, read S1 with FE set and then read D

field.name: NF
field.description: Noise Flag\n NF is set when the UART detects noise on the receiver input.\n To clear NF, read S1 and then read D. When EN709 is enabled, noise flag is not set

field.name: OR
field.description: Receiver Overrun Flag\n OR is set when software fails to prevent the receive data register from overflowing with data.\n To clear OR, read S1 when OR is set and then read D

field.name: IDLE
field.description: Idle Line Flag\n After the IDLE flag is cleared, a frame must be received or a LIN break character must set the S2[LBKDIF] flag before an idle condition can set the IDLE flag.\n To clear IDLE, read UART status S1 with IDLE set and then read D

field.name: RDRF
field.description: Receive Data Register Full Flag\n RDRF is set when the number of datawords in the receive buffer is equal to or more than the number indicated by RWFIFO[RXWATER].\n To clear RDRF, read S1 when RDRF is set and then read D

field.name: TC
field.description:
Transmit Complete Flag
 TC is cleared when there is a transmission in progress or when a preamble or break character is loaded.
 TC is set when the transmit buffer is empty and no data, preamble, or break character is being transmitted.
 TC is cleared by reading S1 with TC set and then doing one of the following:
 - Writing to D to transmit new data.
 - Queuing a preamble by clearing and then setting C2[TE].
 - Queuing a break character by writing 1 to SBK in C2

field.name: TDRE
field.description: Transmit Data Register Empty Flag\n TDRE will set when the number of datawords in the transmit buffer (D and C3[T8])is equal to or less than the number indicated by TWFIFO[TXWATER].\n To clear TDRE, read S1 when TDRE is set and then write to the UART data register

field.name: RAF
field.description:
Receiver Active Flag
 RAF is set when the UART receiver detects a logic 0 during the RT1 time period of the start bit search.
 RAF is cleared when the receiver detects an idle character when C7816[ISO7816E] is cleared/disabled.
 When C7816[ISO7816E] is enabled, the RAF is cleared if the C7816[TTYPE] = 0 expires or the C7816[TTYPE] = 1 expires

field.name: LBKDE
field.description: LIN Break Detection Enable\n Selects a longer break character detection length.\n While LBKDE is set, S1[RDRF], S1[NF], S1[FE], and S1[PF] are prevented from setting

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Short Break detection\t- Break length of 10 bit times (C1[M] = 0), 11 (C1[M] = 1 and C4[M10] = 0), or 12 (C1[M] = 1, C4[M10] = 1, and S1[PE] = 1)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Long Break detection\t- Break length of 11 bits times (if C1[M] = 0 or 12 bits time (if C1[M] = 1)

field.name: BRK13
field.description: Break Transmit Character Length\n Determines whether the transmit break character is 10, 11, or 12 bits long, or 13 or 14 bits long

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Short Breaks\t- Break character is 10, 11, or 12 bits long

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Long Breaks\t- Break character is 13 or 14 bits long

field.name: RWUID
field.description: Receive Wakeup Idle Detect\n When RWU is set and WAKE is cleared, this field controls whether the idle character that wakes the receiver sets S1[IDLE]. This field must be cleared when C7816[ISO7816E] is set/enabled

field.name: RXINV
field.description: Receive Data Inversion\n Setting this field reverses the polarity of the received data input

field.name: MSBF
field.description: Most Significant Bit First\n Setting this field reverses the order of the bits that are transmitted and received on the wire

field.name: RXEDGIF
field.description:
RxD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag
 RXEDGIF is set when an active edge occurs on the RxD pin.
 The active edge is falling if RXINV = 0, and rising if RXINV=1.
 RXEDGIF is cleared by writing a 1 to it

field.name: LBKDIF
field.description: LIN Break Detect Interrupt Flag\n LBKDIF is set when LBKDE is set and a LIN break character is detected on the receiver input.\n LBKDIF is cleared by writing a 1 to it

field.name: PEIE
field.description: Parity Error Interrupt Enable

field.name: FEIE
field.description: Framing Error Interrupt Enable

field.name: NEIE
field.description: Noise Error Interrupt Enable

field.name: ORIE
field.description: Overrun Error Interrupt Enable

field.name: TXINV
field.description: Transmit Data Inversion

field.name: TXDIR
field.description: Transmitter Pin Direction in Single-Wire mode

field.name: T8
field.description: Transmit Bit 8

field.name: R8
field.description: Received Bit 8

register.name: D
register.description:
Data Register
 Reads return the contents of the read-only receive data buffer and 
 writes go to the write-only transmit data buffer. 
 Reads and writes of this register are also involved in the automatic flag clearing mechanisms for the UART status flags

field.name: RT
field.description: Read receive data or write transmit data

field.name: MA
field.description: Match Address

field.name: BRFA
field.description: Baud Rate Fine Adjust

field.name: M10
field.description: 10-bit Mode select

field.name: MAEN2
field.description: Match Address Mode Enable 2

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN1 is cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA2 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer

field.name: MAEN1
field.description: Match Address Mode Enable 1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN2 is cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA1 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer

field.name: RDMAS
field.description: Receiver Full Interrupt/DMA Select\n Selects between DMA and interrupt requests when C2[RIE] and S1[RDRF] flags are set

field.name: TDMAS
field.description: Transmitter Interrupt/DMA Select\n Selects between DMA and interrupt requests when C2[TIE] and S1[TDRE] flags are set

field.name: PARITYE
field.description: Parity Error\n Indicates if the current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with a parity error

field.name: NOISY
field.description: Noise Error\n The current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with noise

field.name: TXCTSE
field.description:
Transmitter clear-to-send enable
 If enabled, the transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. 
 If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted.
 Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission

field.name: TXRTSE
field.description: Transmitter request-to-send enable\n If enabled, when a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer(FIFO), RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. \n RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer(FIFO) and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit

field.name: TXRTSPOL
field.description: Transmitter request-to-send polarity

field.name: RXRTSE
field.description: Receiver request-to-send enable\n If enabled RTS is deasserted if the number of characters in the receiver data register (FIFO) is equal to or greater than RWFIFO[RXWATER].\n RTS is asserted when the number of characters in the receiver data register (FIFO) is less than RWFIFO[RXWATER]

field.name: RXFIFOSIZE
field.description: Receive FIFO Depth

field.name: RXFE
field.description: Receive FIFO Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO disabled\t- Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO enabled\t- Buffer is depth indicated by RXFIFOSIZE

field.name: TXFIFOSIZE
field.description: Transmit FIFO. Buffer Depth

field.name: TXFE
field.description: Transmit FIFO Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO disabled\t- Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO enabled\t- Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE

field.name: RXUFE
field.description: Receive FIFO Underflow Interrupt Enable\n If this bit is set, the RXUF flag generates an interrupt

field.name: TXOFE
field.description: Transmit FIFO Overflow Interrupt Enable\n If this bit is set, the TXOF flag generates an interrupt

field.name: RXOFE
field.description: Receive FIFO Overflow Interrupt Enable\n If this bit is set, the RXOF flag generates an interrupt

field.name: RXFLUSH
field.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer Flush\n Writing to this field causes all data that is stored in the receive FIFO/buffer to be flushed.\n This does not affect data that is in the receive shift register

field.name: TXFLUSH
field.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer Flush\n Writing to this field causes all data that is stored in the transmit FIFO/buffer to be flushed.\n This does not affect data that is in the transmit shift register

field.name: RXUF
field.description: Receiver Buffer Underflow Flag\n Indicates that more data has been read from the receive buffer than was present

field.name: TXOF
field.description: Transmitter Buffer Overflow Flag\n Indicates that more data has been written to the transmit buffer than it can hold

field.name: RXOF
field.description: Receiver Buffer Overflow Flag\n Indicates that more data has been written to the receive buffer than it can hold

field.name: RXEMPT
field.description: Receive Buffer/FIFO Empty

field.name: TXEMPT
field.description: Transmit Buffer/FIFO Empty

field.name: TXWATER
field.description: Transmit Watermark

field.name: TXCOUNT
field.description: Transmit Counter

field.name: RXWATER
field.description: Receive Watermark

field.name: RXCOUNT
field.description: Receive Counter

field.name: ISO_7816E
field.description: ISO-7816 Functionality Enabled

field.name: TTYPE
field.description: Transfer Type\nIndicates the transfer protocol being used

field.name: INIT
field.description: Detect Initial Character\n When this field is set, all received characters are searched for a valid initial character.\n If an invalid initial character is identified, and ANACK is set, a NACK is sent

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operating mode\t- Receiver does not seek to identify initial character

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Search mode\t- Receiver searches for initial character

field.name: ANACK
field.description: Generate NACK on Error\n A NACK may be automatically generated if a parity error is detected or if an invalid initial character is detected

field.name: ONACK
field.description: Generate NACK on Overflow\n A NACK may be automatically sent if a receive buffer overrun occurs

field.name: RXTE
field.description: Receive Threshold Exceeded (RXT) Interrupt Enable

field.name: TXTE
field.description: Transmit Threshold Exceeded (TXT) Interrupt Enable

field.name: GTVE
field.description: Guard Timer Violated (GTV) Interrupt Enable

field.name: INITDE
field.description: Initial Character Detected (INITD) Interrupt Enable

field.name: BWTE
field.description: Block Wait Timer (BWT) Interrupt Enable

field.name: CWTE
field.description: Character Wait Timer (CWT) Interrupt Enable

field.name: WTE
field.description: Wait Timer Interrupt Enable

field.name: RXT
field.description: Receive Threshold Exceeded Interrupt\n Set if the number of consecutive NACKS generated as a result of parity errors and buffer overruns is >= the value in ET7816[RXTHRESHOLD]

field.name: TXT
field.description: Transmit Threshold Exceeded Interrupt\n Set if the number of retries and corresponding NACKS > the value in the ET7816[TXTHRESHOLD] field

field.name: GTV
field.description: Guard Timer Violated Interrupt\n Set if a guard time (GT, CGT or BGT) has been violated

field.name: INITD
field.description: Initial Character Detected Interrupt\n Set when a valid initial character has been received

field.name: BWT
field.description: Block Wait Timer Interrupt\n Set when the Block Wait Time (BWT) has been violated

field.name: CWT
field.description: Character Wait Timer Interrupt\n Set when the Character Wait Time (CWT) has been violated

field.name: WT
field.description: Wait Timer Interrupt\n Set when the Wait Time (WT) has been violated

field.name: WI
field.description: Wait Timer Interrupt (C7816[TTYPE] = 0)

field.name: BWI
field.description: Block Wait Time Integer(C7816[TTYPE] = 1)

field.name: CWI
field.description: Character Wait Time Integer (C7816[TTYPE] = 1)

field.name: GTN
field.description: Guard Band N

field.name: GTFD
field.description: FD Multiplier

field.name: RXTHRESHOLD
field.description: Receive NACK Threshold\n The value written to this field indicates the maximum number of consecutive NACKs generated as a result of a parity error or receiver buffer overruns before the host processor is notified

field.name: TXTHRESHOLD
field.description: Transmit NACK Threshold\n The value written to this field indicates the maximum number of failed attempts (NACKs) a transmitted character can have before the host processor is notified

field.name: TLEN
field.description: Transmit Length
